title: Erica Eloff
text:
Erica Eloff is a South African <a href="soprano">soprano</a> specializing in <a href="opera">opera</a>, <a href="lieder">lieder</a> and <a href="oratorio">oratorio</a>, currently residing in <a href="Linz">Linz</a>, Austria. She made her professional debut in the UK during the summer of 2008 at <a href="Garsington%20Opera">Garsington Opera</a> as Fiordiligi in <a href="Mozart">Mozart</a>'s "<a href="Cosi%20fan%20tutte">Così fan tutte</a>". She also made her <a href="Wigmore%20Hall">Wigmore Hall</a> debut in their 2008/09 season with the pianist <a href="http%3A//www.ycat.co.uk/james-baillieu">James Baillieu</a> as a <a href="http%3A//www.kirckman.org.uk/html/eloff.htm">Kirckman Concert Society</a> Artist and made a critically acclaimed return in their 2009/10 season.
Eloff graduated with distinction from the <a href="North-West%20University">North-West University</a>, Potchefstroom, where she earned multiple prizes and scholarships. She also won numerous singing prizes including the London <a href="https%3A//web.archive.org/web/20100328115648/http%3A//www.handel.cswebsites.org/default.aspx%3Fpage%3D19603">Handel Singing Competition</a> (2008), the <a href="http%3A//www.unisa.ac.za/Default.asp%3FCmd%3DViewContent%26amp%3BContentID%3D22106">UNISA National Singing Competition</a> (2005), the <a href="https%3A//web.archive.org/web/20110720233749/http%3A//www.infoservice.fr/ufam/accueil/2004c.htm">UFAM Concours Internationaux de Chant</a>, "degré Honneur" (2003) in France, and the Singing Category and Overall winner of ATKV Forté (2000) (renamed <a href="https%3A//web.archive.org/web/20110904152349/http%3A//www.atkvprojekte.co.za/index.php%3Foption%3Dcom_content%26amp%3Bview%3Dcategory%26amp%3Blayout%3Dblog%26amp%3Bid%3D231%26amp%3BItemid%3D158">ATKV Muziq</a>). In the UK she was also selected by <a href="http%3A//www.makingmusic.org.uk/our-work/awards/award-for-young-concert-artists">Making Music</a> as a Philip and Dorothy Green Young Concert Artist. Eloff has been featured on BBC Radio 3's "In Tune" and interviewed by Bob Jones for <a href="Classic%20FM%20%28UK%29">Classic FM</a>.
Eloff works extensively as oratorio singer and recitalist in the UK, Germany, Belgium and South Africa and has also performed for various smaller opera companies in the UK. Her performance credits include Belinda in <a href="Henry%20Purcell">Purcell</a>'s "<a href="Dido%20and%20Aeneas">Dido and Aeneas</a>", The Queen of the Night and First Lady in <a href="Mozart">Mozart</a>'s "<a href="Zauberfl%C3%B6te">Zauberflöte</a>," Floria Tosca in <a href="Giacomo%20Puccini">Puccini</a>'s "<a href="Tosca">Tosca</a>" and Violetta Valéry in <a href="Verdi">Verdi</a>'s "<a href="La%20Traviata">La Traviata</a>". She also understudied the title role in <a href="Beethoven">Beethoven</a>'s "<a href="Fidelio">Fidelio</a>" for <a href="Garsington%20Opera">Garsington Opera</a>.
